info.description: # Intro This website documents the API methods available for the `walletAPI` program. The default API url is [127.0.0.1:8440](http://127.0.0.1:8440). Note that this program is distinct from `XTCASHservice`, which uses a different API. The api docs for `XTCASHservice` can be found [here](https://documentation.trrxitte.com/developer/api/Legacy-Wallet-RPC-API/). When using the docs, be aware that you can click the 'Model' tab to get a description of all available parameters, their types, and an example value. # Initialization * Start by launching the `walletAPI` program. * From a terminal (or via a programming language): ``` ./walletAPI --rpc-password somepassword ``` * Or if you're on windows: ``` walletAPI.exe --rpc-password somepassword ``` * An RPC password is always required, and you should then provide this password with every request to the API, in the `X-API-KEY` header. * If you want to see the available configuration options for the `walletAPI`, launch the program with: ``` ./walletAPI --help ``` * Note that you cannot generate/open a wallet via the command line, only via the API. This is by design to prevent application developers having to parse command line output. # Try it Out If you want to test walletAPI out without doing any programming, you can use the 'Try it out' section in swagger. * Start by launching your wallet with CORS enabled: ``` ./walletAPI --rpc-password "mypassword" --enable-cors "*" ``` * Click the 'Authorize' button in Swagger, and type in the RPC password you just chose - in this case, "mypassword", and click 'Authorize'. * Click a method to expand it, then click the 'Try it Out' button. * You can modify the parameters you want to send here, and then hit 'Execute' to send the request. * Note that this may not work in Firefox, I had to use Chrome to get it to work. F12 (developer console) may help diagnose CORS issues. # API Wrappers Finally, whilst you may send raw HTTP requests to the API url, you may be interested in an API/RPC wrapper. These can be generated for many languages, by using the `Generate Client` option in the top menu. Be patient, this can take some time to complete. # Support If you are having issues, please stop by our [discord](http://chat.traaittplatform.lol) and visit the `#dev_learning` channel for assistance.
info.title: walletAPI

tags.name: keys
tags.description: Get private keys or mnemonic seed

tags.name: transactions
tags.description: Get a list of transactions, send a transaction

tags.name: balance
tags.description: Get a wallets or an addresses balance

tags.name: misc
tags.description: Miscellaneous operations, such as saving, getting status, etc

post.summary: Imports a wallet with a private spend and view key
Imports a wallet using a mnemonic seed
Imports a view only wallet with a private view key and public address
post.description: Note that view only wallets can only see incoming transactions, so balance may be inflated, and they cannot send transactions.

delete.summary: Closes and saves the opened wallet

put.summary: Resets and saves the wallet, beginning scanning from height given, if any

scanHeight.description: The block height to start scanning from

get.summary: Gets the node address, port, fee, and fee address

nodeFee.description: The fee the node you are connected to on each transaction (in atomic units)

nodeAddress.description: The address the node fee gets sent to, if non zero

put.summary: Sets the node address and port

post.summary: Validate an address. If the address is valid, a 200 response code will be returned, else a 400 response code will be returned.

isIntegrated.description: Whether the address is an integrated address

paymentID.description: If the address is integrated, this will hold the integrated payment ID

actualAddress.description: If the address is integrated, this will hold the extracted actual address. Otherwise, it will be the passed in address.

publicSpendKey.description: The public spend key of the passed in address

publicViewKey.description: The public view key of the passed in address

get.summary: Gets the wallet containers shared private view key
Gets the public and private spend key for the given address
get.description: Note that this method cannot be used with a view only wallet

get.summary: Gets the mnemonic seed for the given address, if possible
get.description: Note that this method cannot be used with a view only wallet

mnemonicSeed.example: leech lifestyle newt tarnished vials weavers decay nerves buying taken sample after jailed cupcake token pavements welders gifts ferry keep humid abbey emails entrance leech

get.summary: Get the wallet sync status, peer count, and hashrate

walletBlockCount.description: The amount of blocks the wallet has scanned

localDaemonBlockCount.description: The amount of blocks the daemon the wallet is connected to has synced

networkBlockCount.description: The amount of blocks the network has

peerCount.description: The amount of peers (incoming + outgoing) peers the daemon has

hashrate.description: The hashrate the last local block the daemon knows about has

isViewWallet.description: Whether this wallet is a view only wallet. Certain operations are illegal on a view only wallet, such as transferring.

subWalletCount.description: The amount of subwallets in the container

get.summary: Gets a list of all addresses in the wallet container

delete.summary: Deletes the given subwallet from the container
delete.description: Note that you cannot delete the 'primary' address, the first address created in the wallet.

get.summary: Gets the 'primary' address
get.description: The primary address is the first wallet created, and the one used as the change address if not specified.

post.summary: Creates a new, random address in the wallet container

privateSpendKey.description: The corresponding private spend key for this address, can be used to restore along with the shared private view key

publicSpendKey.description: The corresponding public spend key for this address, can be used to restore a view wallet along with the shared private view key

post.summary: Imports a subwallet with the given private spend key
post.description: It is HIGHLY recommended you provide a scan height with this operation - wallet syncing will have to begin again from the scan height given (defaults to zero) if the scan height is less than the height of the current wallet sync status.

scanHeight.description: The daemon port to sync the wallet with

post.summary: Imports a view only subwallet with the given publicSpendKey
post.description: It is HIGHLY recommended you provide a scan height with this operation - wallet syncing will have to begin again from the scan height given (defaults to zero) if the scan height is less than the height of the current wallet sync status.

scanHeight.description: The daemon port to sync the wallet with

get.summary: Creates an integrated address from an address and payment ID
Gets a list of all transactions in the wallet container
Gets details on the given transaction, if found
get.description: Note that the transaction must be contained in this wallet, and must not be unconfirmed. E.g, you must get this hash back when calling /transactions

404.description: The transaction hash was not found.

get.summary: Gets a list of all unconfirmed, outgoing transactions in the wallet container
get.description: Note that this DOES NOT include incoming transactions in the pool. This only applies to transactions that have been sent by this wallet file, and have not been added to a block yet.

get.summary: Gets a list of unconfirmed, outgoing transactions, for the given address
get.description: Note that this DOES NOT include incoming transactions in the pool. This only applies to transactions that have been sent by this wallet file, and have not been added to a block yet.

get.summary: Returns transactions for the wallet starting at start height for 1,000 blocks
Returns transactions for the wallet starting at start height until end height
get.description: Note that start height must be < end height

get.summary: Returns transactions for the wallet starting at start height for 1,000 blocks, that belong to the given address
get.description: Note that the transfers array will still contain transfers to other addresses, if present

get.summary: Returns transactions for the wallet starting at start height until end height, that belong to the given address
get.description: Note that start height must be < end height. Also note that the transfers array will still contain transfers to other addresses, if present.

post.description: This method will take funds from all subwallets as needed, and will use the primary address as the change address. It also uses a default fee, and default mixin. If this is not acceptable, please use the /advanced call instead.

destination.description: The address to send funds to

amount.description: The amount of XTCASH to send (in atomic units)

post.summary: Creates a transaction but does not relay it to the network
post.description: This method will take funds from all subwallets as needed, and will use the primary address as the change address. It also uses a default fee, and default mixin. If this is not acceptable, please use the /advanced call instead. Allows you to review the created transactions fee before deciding whether to commit to paying that fee. Prepared transactions can be sent using `/transactions/send/prepared`, or cancelled with `/transactions/prepared`. Note that every parameters sans destinations is optional.

destination.description: The address to send funds to

amount.description: The amount of XTCASH to send (in atomic units)

post.description: Note that every parameters sans destinations is optional.

post.summary: Creates a transaction but does not relay it to the network
post.description: Allows you to review the created transactions fee before deciding whether to commit to paying that fee. Prepared transactions can be sent using `/transactions/send/prepared`, or cancelled with `/transactions/prepared`. Note that every parameters sans destinations is optional.
Submits a transaction that was previously prepared with `/transactions/prepare/basic` or `/transactions/prepare/advanced` to the network.

transactionHash.description: The transaction hash returned by a previous `/transactions/prepare/basic` or `/transactions/prepare/advanced` call

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The prepared transaction hash to cancel. This hash is returned from the `/transactions/prepared/basic` or `/transactions/prepared/advanced` methods.

delete.description: While it is not mandatory to call this method for a prepared transaction you do not wish to send, it is highly advised, as it will free up RAM.

404.description: The prepared transaction hash given was not found. Note that prepared transactions are lost upon restarting the wallet process.

post.description: Fusion transactions are zero fee, and seek to combine small inputs into larger ones, to allow for larger transactions. Many fusions may be required to fully optimize a wallet.
Fusion transactions are zero fee, and seek to combine small inputs into larger ones, to allow for larger transactions. Many fusions may be required to fully optimize a wallet.

sourceAddresses.description: The addresses to draw funds for the transaction from (must be an address in this container)

destination.description: The destination address to send funds to. Must exist in this wallet.

get.summary: Gets the transaction private key of the given transaction. This can be used to audit a transaction.
get.description: The transaction must have been sent by this wallet container. If the wallet container has been reimported, it will not be present.

get.summary: Get the balance for the entire wallet container

unlocked.description: Unlocked, spendable balance. In atomic units.

locked.description: Locked, unspendable balance. Possibly unconfirmed change, or a transaction with an unlock time specified. In atomic units.

get.summary: Get the balance for a specific address

unlocked.description: Unlocked, spendable balance. In atomic units.

locked.description: Locked, unspendable balance. Possibly unconfirmed change, or a transaction with an unlock time specified. In atomic units.

get.summary: Get the balance for every address

unlocked.description: Unlocked, spendable balance. In atomic units.

locked.description: Locked, unspendable balance. Possibly unconfirmed change, or a transaction with an unlock time specified. In atomic units.

address.description: The address this balance belongs to

api_key.name: X-API-KEY
api_key.description: Your rpc password that you supplied on starting the wallet API.

UnauthorizedError.description: API key is missing or invalid.

AlreadyOpen.description: A wallet is already open. Call DELETE on /wallet first, to close it.

BadRequest.description: A parse error occured, or an error occured processing your request.

errorCode.description: A numeric code representing the error, for programmatic use. Error code mappings can be found here - https://github.com/traaittplatform/traaittplatform/blob/development/src/WalletBackend/WalletErrors.h We will endeavour to not change these mappings.

errorMessage.description: A human readable error message, for displaying to the user. It is suggested for programmers to not pattern match on these, and instead use the errorCode.
errorMessage.example: The password given for this wallet is incorrect.

NotOpen.description: This operation requires a wallet to be open, and one has not been opened.

InternalError.description: An exception was thrown whilst processing the request. See the console for logs.

filename.description: The filename to store/load the wallet from. Note that this is relative to where traaitt-walletAPI was launched from - it is recommended you use an absolute path.

password.description: The password used to open the wallet

scanHeight.description: The daemon port to sync the wallet with

mnemonicSeed.example: cynical waveform sixteen husband zebra ritual vexed jaws eccentric jewels toenail having nabbing wept nozzle grunt tipsy flying pegs feel upright lower racetrack sapling sapling

daemonHost.description: The daemon host to sync the wallet with

daemonPort.description: The daemon port to sync the wallet with

amount.description: The amount of XTCASH to send (in atomic units)

mixin.default: The default mixin defined by the core software for the current height

fee.description: The fee to use with this transaction (in atomic units)

feePerByte.description: The amount in atomic units to pay for each byte of the resulting transaction size

items.description: The addresses to draw funds for the transaction from (must be an address in this container). Defaults to every address.

changeAddress.description: The address in this wallet to return any 'change' to if we have to spend more than the requested amount. Defaults to primary address.

unlockTime.description: When to unlock the transaction. A user cannot spend locked funds until the unlock time has been reached. Defaults to zero if not given. Can use either a block height, or a unix timestamp.

extra.description: Hex representation of any extra data to be included in the `tx_extra` field of the transaction.

blockHeight.description: The block this transaction is contained in.

fee.description: The amount the sender paid in miner fees for this transaction. In atomic units.

isCoinbaseTransaction.description: Whether this transaction is a miner reward or a normal transaction.

paymentID.description: An identifier supplied by the sender. May be "" (empty string)

timestamp.description: The unix timestamp of the block this transaction is contained in.

unlockTime.description: When this transaction unlocks for spending. If >= 50000000, treated as a timestamp. Normally zero.

address.description: The receiving address of this transfer, or the sending address if the amount is negative

amount.description: The amount of this transfer, in atomic units

address.name: address
address.description: The address to use for this operation. Should be a valid, 98 character XTCASH address.

paymentID.name: paymentID
paymentID.description: The payment ID to use for this operation. Should be a 64 char hex string.

hash.name: hash
hash.description: The transaction hash to use for this operation. Should be a 64 char hex string.

startHeight.name: startHeight
startHeight.description: The starting block height to use for this operation.

endHeight.name: endHeight
endHeight.description: The ending block height to use for this operation.
